instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> emc 2909, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> overheating.
threads.message:
I have this MacBook.
Without using the MacBook, the cpu is 40° and the fan spinning at 1000rpm
When it is in hard use(YouTube 4k, Photoshop...) the cpu go to 100°c but the fan are still spinning at 1000rpm, I think it is not normal.

Any ideas... Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> emc 2909, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> overheating.
threads.message:
Did you try another fan?
Install Macs Fan Control and set fan speed to follow CPU die.
Lets see if increases the speed.
